scar

Class StoreFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • scar.StoreFile

  • public class StoreFile
extends java.lang.Object
    StoreFile has the combined logic to take a file and store it across our servers in chunk form An overview of the process can be seen:

        k - k
        n - n
        srvs - all known sevrers in the system

      • add_garbage

        private byte[][] add_garbage(byte[][] good)
        generates and inserts garbage chunks into our chunk array to confuse attackers
        Parameters:
        good - our good valid chunks

      • distribute_chunks

        private Chunk[] distribute_chunks(byte[][] chunk_data,
                                  byte[][] hc)
        Genererates the distribution of chunks given the hashchain Basic Algorithm
        1. make a list of chunk ids
        2. pick from this list with removal via current hash in hashchain
        3. assign this chunk to the current virtual server
        4. increment to next virtual server modulo the maximum virtual servers
        Basically a round robin distribution of chunks given by the hashchain as far as what chunk goes to what server
        Parameters:
        hc - hashchain
        Returns:
        array of chunks with their server information set and indexing set

      • store

        public ChunkMeta[] store()
        Actual combined logic to take a file from a byte array and store it as chunks across the servers we gave as input The flow of this is as followed:
        1. Encrypt our input data if desired
        2. Pad the encrypted data for RS
        3. Perform RS on the data to get our N chunks
        4. Compute the hashchain for the N chunks
        5. Compute the distribution of chunks to servers
        6. Shuffle the chunks
        7. Execute the uploads of the chunks to their servers
        Returns:
        An array of chunk meta corresponding to all the chunks we uploaded
